docs.title: Problem 1 - Multiples of 3 or 5
docs.text:
Solution Python 
# Multiples of 3 or 5


# Solution 1
multiples = []

for number in range(1, 1000):
    if number % 5 == 0 or number % 3 == 0:
        multiples.append(number)

print(sum(multiples))

docs.title: Problem 2 - Even Fibonacci numbers
docs.text:
Solution Python 
# Even Fibonacci numbers


# Solution 1
a, b = 0, 1
maximum = 4_000_000

even_terms = []
while a + b <= maximum:
    fib = a + b
    if fib % 2 == 0:
        even_terms.append(fib)
    a, b = b, fib

print(sum(even_terms))

docs.title: Problem 3 - Largest prime factor
docs.text:
Solution Python 
# Largest prime factor


# Solution 1
import math

from primePy import primes

prime = primes.factors(600851475143)
print(prime[-1])


# Solution 2
def prime_factors(num):
    largest_prime_factor = 1
    while num % 2 == 0:
        largest_prime_factor = 2
        num = num / 2

    for i in range(3, int(math.sqrt(num)) + 1, 2):
        while num % i == 0:
            largest_prime_factor = i
            num = num / i
    if num > 2:
        largest_prime_factor = num

    return largest_prime_factor


num = 600851475143
print(prime_factors(num))

docs.title: Problem 4 - Largest palindrome product
Problem 5 - Smallest multiple
Problem 6 - Sum square difference
docs.text:
Solution Python 
# Sum square difference


# Solution 1
a = 0
b = 0

for i in range(1, 101):
    a = a + pow(i, 2)

for i in range(1, 101):
    b = b + i
b = pow(b, 2)

print(b - a)

docs.title: Problem 7 - 10001st prime
docs.text:
Solution Python 
# 10001st prime


# Solution 1
num = 2
primes = []


def is_prime(n):
    for i in range(2, n):
        if (n % i) == 0:
            return False
    return True


while len(primes) != 10001:
    if is_prime(num) == True:
        primes.append(num)
    num = num + 1
print(primes[10000])


# Solution 2
from primePy import primes

a = primes.first(10001)
print(a[-1])

docs.title: Problem 8 - Largest product in a series
Problem 9 - Special Pythagorean triplet
Problem 14 - Longest Collatz sequence
docs.text:
Solution Python 
# Longest Collatz sequence


# Solution 1
from tqdm import tqdm


def chain(num):
    items = 1
    while num != 1:
        if num % 2 == 1:
            num = 3 * num + 1
        else:
            num = num / 2
        items += 1
    return items


max_items = 0
n = 0

for i in tqdm(range(1, 1000000)):
    items = chain(i)
    if items > max_items:
        max_items = items
        n = i

print(n)

Thanks to all 2 contributors.
